abstract: Hillary Clinton speaks out against violence against police officers at annual convention held by NAACP in Cincinnati, where she addresses shootings in Dallas and Baton Rouge, La, and highlights need to rebuild deteriorating race relations across country.
lead_paragraph: The presumptive Democratic nominee condemned the recent killings of police officers while also pressing law enforcement to make reforms.

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and THOMAS KAPLAN

headline.main: ‘Madness Has to Stop,’ Hillary Clinton Declares at N.A.A.C.P. Conference
headline.print_headline: ‘Painful, Essential’ Rebuilding Ahead, Clinton Tells N.A.A.C.P. Leaders

snippet: The presumptive Democratic nominee condemned the recent killings of police officers while also pressing law enforcement to make reforms....
